column4: Howdy Guys! I'm dual booting xp and ubuntu..can anyone tell me a way to use xp from inside ubuntu ? :-)
that factoid doesn't mention it but there's also virt-manager for use with KVM. I prefer KVM for Linux guests and VirtualBox for Windows guests.
migrating a bare-metal install to VirtualBox is possible but not the easiest thing in the world to do.
I suggest the non-free VirtualBox from VirtualBox.org
for one, you get the new 3.0 version.
there are various ways. a virtual NAT, a bridged network interface, virtual interfaces. In short, yes.
I don't know of any Google services that don't work in any Linux. What's not working?
what about a real simple browser like lynx?
does it just sit there and eventually time out, or you get DNS errors, or what?
no buffer space available? that doesn't sound good.
